alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Leslie; Owsley; Perry; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Laurel, central Owsley, northwestern Leslie, western Perry, southern Jackson, east central Rockcastle and northern Clay Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 313 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Horse Lick to Thomas to Taff. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newfound, Felty, Teges, Trixie, Thomas, Sebastian, Taff, Laurel Creek, Gobbard and Sextons Creek around 320 PM EDT. Ammie, Seth, Oneida, Hensley, Mistletoe, Wild Cat, Tanksley, Mill Pond and Bernice around 325 PM EDT. Manchester, Barcreek, Brutus, Spurlock, Whoopflarea, Littleton, Settle Store and Welchburg around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Panco, Enline, Jacks Creek, Hector, Saul, Royrader, Datha, High Knob, Big Creek, Peabody, Crawford, Sizerock, Benge, Langnau, Bear Branch, Portersburg, Byron, Fogertown, Grace, Urban, Kaliopi and Sidell. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 28 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Leslie; Owsley; Perry; Rockcastle
